intro: Ruprechtia corylifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ruprechtia corylifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
